g5401.definition: [φόβος] from a primary φέβομαι (to be put in fear); alarm or fright

g5402.definition: [Φοίβη] feminine of φοῖβος (bright; probably akin to the base of {{g5457}}); Phœbe, a Christian woman

g5403.definition: [Φοινίκη] from {{g5404}}; palm-country; Phœnice (or Phœnicia), a region of Palestine

g5405.definition: [Φοῖνιξ] probably the same as {{g5404}}; Phœnix, a place in Crete

g5406.definition: [φονεύς] from {{g5408}}; a murderer (always of criminal (or at least intentional) homicide; which {{g443}} does not necessarily imply; while {{g4607}} is a special term for a public bandit)

g5408.definition: [φόνος] from an obsolete primary φένω (to slay); murder

g5409.definition: [φορέω] from {{g5411}}; to have a burden, i.e. (by analogy) to wear as clothing or a constant accompaniment

g5410.definition: [Φόρον] of Latin origin; a forum or market-place; only in comparative with {{g675}}; a station on the Appian road

g5411.definition: [φόρος] from {{g5342}}; a load (as borne), i.e. (figuratively) a tax (properly, an individual assessment on persons or property; whereas {{g5056}} is usually a general toll on goods or travel)

g5412.definition: [φορτίζω] from {{g5414}}; to load up (properly, as a vessel or animal), i.e. (figuratively) to overburden with ceremony (or spiritual anxiety)

g5413.definition: [φορτίον] diminutive of {{g5414}}; an invoice (as part of freight), i.e. (figuratively) a task or service

g5414.definition: [φόρτος] from {{g5342}}; something carried, i.e. the cargo of a ship

g5415.definition: [Φορτουνᾶτος] of Latin origin; "fortunate"; Fortunatus, a Christian

g5416.definition: [φραγέλλιον] neuter of a derivative from the base of {{g5417}}; a whip, i.e. Roman lash as a public punishment

g5417.definition: [φραγελλόω] from a presumed equivalent of the Latin ; to whip, i.e. lash as a public punishment

g5418.definition: [φραγμός] from {{g5420}}; a fence, or inclosing barrier (literally or figuratively)

g5419.definition: [φράζω] probably akin to {{g5420}} through the idea of defining; to indicate (by word or act), i.e. (specially), to expound

g5420.definition: [φράσσω] apparently a strengthening form of the base of {{g5424}}; to fence or inclose, i.e. (specially), to block up (figuratively, to silence)

g5421.definition: [φρέαρ] of uncertain derivation; a hole in the ground (dug for obtaining or holding water or other purposes), i.e. a cistern or well; figuratively, an abyss (as a prison)

g5422.definition: [φρεναπατάω] from {{g5423}}; to be a mind-misleader, i.e. delude

g5423.definition: [φρεναπάτης] from {{g5424}} and {{g539}}; a mind-misleader, i.e. seducer

g5424.definition: [φρήν] probably from an obsolete φράω (to rein in or curb; compare {{g5420}}); the midrif (as a partition of the body), i.e. (figuratively and by implication, of sympathy) the feelings (or sensitive nature; by extension (also in the plural) the mind or cognitive faculties)

g5425.definition: [φρίσσω] apparently a primary verb; to "bristle" or chill, i.e. shudder (fear)

g5426.definition: [φρονέω] from {{g5424}}; to exercise the mind, i.e. entertain or have a sentiment or opinion; by implication, to be (mentally) disposed (more or less earnestly in a certain direction); intensively, to interest oneself in (with concern or obedience)

g5428.definition: [φρόνησις] from {{g5426}}; mental action or activity, i.e. intellectual or moral insight

g5429.definition: [φρόνιμος] from {{g5424}}; thoughtful, i.e. sagacious or discreet (implying a cautious character; while {{g4680}} denotes practical skill or acumen; and {{g4908}} indicates rather intelligence or mental acquirement); in a bad sense conceited (also in the comparative)

g5431.definition: [φροντίζω] from a derivative of {{g5424}}; to exercise thought, i.e. be anxious

g5432.definition: [φρουρέω] from a compound of {{g4253}} and {{g3708}}; to be a watcher in advance, i.e. to mount guard as a sentinel (post spies at gates); figuratively, to hem in, protect Compare {{g5083}}.

g5433.definition: [φρυάσσω] akin to {{g1032}}, {{g1031}}; to snort (as a spirited horse), i.e. (figuratively) to make a tumult

g5434.definition: [φρύγανον] neuter of a presumed derivative of φρύγω (to roast or parch; akin to the base of {{g5395}}); something desiccated, i.e. a dry twig

g5435.definition: [Φρυγία] probably of foreign origin; Phrygia, a region of Asia Minor

g5436.definition: [Φύγελλος] probably from {{g5343}}; fugitive; Phygellus, an apostate Christian

g5438.definition: [φυλακή] from {{g5442}}; a guarding or (concretely, guard), the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or (specially), the time (as a division of day or night), literally or figuratively

g5440.definition: [φυλακτήριον] neuter of a derivative of {{g5442}}; a guard-case, i.e. "phylactery" for wearing slips of Scripture texts

g5442.definition: [φυλάσσω] probably from {{g5443}} through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. be on guard (literally of figuratively); by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid Compare {{g5083}}.

g5443.definition: [φυλή] from {{g5453}} (compare {{g5444}}); an offshoot, i.e. race or clan

g5444.definition: [φύλλον] from the same as {{g5443}}; a sprout, i.e. leaf

g5445.definition: [φύραμα] from a prolonged form of φύρω (to mix a liquid with a solid; perhaps akin to {{g5453}} through the idea of swelling in bulk), mean to knead; a mass of dough

g5448.definition: [φυσιόω] from {{g5449}} in the primary sense of blowing; to inflate, i.e. (figuratively) make proud (haughty)

g5449.definition: [φύσις] from {{g5453}}; growth (by germination or expansion), i.e. (by implication) natural production (lineal descent); by extension, a genus or sort; figuratively, native disposition, constitution or usage

g5451.definition: [φυτεία] from {{g5452}}; trans-planting, i.e. (concretely) a shrub or vegetable

g5452.definition: [φυτεύω] from a derivative of {{g5453}}; to set out in the earth, i.e. implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine

g5453.definition: [φύω] a primary verb; probably originally, to "puff" or blow, i.e. to swell up; but only used in the implied sense, to germinate or grow (sprout, produce), literally or figuratively

g5454.definition: [φωλεός] of uncertain derivative; a burrow or lurking-place

g5455.definition: [φωνέω] from {{g5456}}; to emit a sound (animal, human or instrumental); by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation

g5456.definition: [φωνή] probably akin to {{g5316}} through the idea of disclosure; a tone (articulate, bestial or artificial); by implication, an address (for any purpose), saying or language

g5457.definition: [φῶς] from an obsolete φάω (to shine or make manifest, especially by rays; compare {{g5316}}, {{g5346}}); luminousness (in the widest application, natural or artificial, abstract or concrete, literal or figurative)

g5458.definition: [φωστήρ] from {{g5457}}; an illuminator, i.e. (concretely) a luminary, or (abstractly) brilliancy

g5459.definition: [φωσφόρος] from {{g5457}} and {{g5342}}; light-bearing ("phosphorus"), i.e. (specially), the morning-star (figuratively)

g5460.definition: [φωτεινός] from {{g5457}}; lustrous, i.e. transparent or well-illuminated (figuratively)

g5461.definition: [φωτίζω] from {{g5457}}; to shed rays, i.e. to shine or (transitively) to brighten up (literally or figuratively)

g5463.definition: [χαίρω] a primary verb; to be "cheer"ful, i.e. calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation (on meeting or parting), be well

g5465.definition: [χαλάω] from the base of {{g5490}}; to lower (as into a void)

g5466.definition: [Χαλδαῖος] probably of Hebrew or ({{h3778}}); a Chaldæan (i.e. Kasdi), or native or the region of the lower Euphrates

g5467.definition: [χαλεπός] perhaps from {{g5465}} through the idea of reducing the strength; difficult, i.e. dangerous, or (by implication) furious

g5468.definition: [χαλιναγωγέω] from a compound of {{g5469}} and the reduplicated form of {{g71}}; to be a bit-leader, i.e. to curb (figuratively)

g5469.definition: [χαλινός] from {{g5465}}; a curb or head-stall (as curbing the spirit)

g5474.definition: [χαλκολίβανον] neuter of a compound of {{g5475}} and {{g3030}} (in the implied mean of whiteness or brilliancy); burnished copper, an alloy of copper (or gold) and silver having a brilliant lustre

g5475.definition: [χαλκός] perhaps from {{g5465}} through the idea of hollowing out as a vessel (this metal being chiefly used for that purpose); copper (the substance, or some implement or coin made of it)

g5476.definition: [χαμαί] adverb perhaps from the base of {{g5490}} through the idea of a fissure in the soil; earthward, i.e. prostrate

g5477.definition: [Χαναάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h3667}}); Chanaan (i.e. Kenaan), the early name of Palestine

g5478.definition: [Χανααναῖος] from {{g5477}}; a Chanaanæan (i.e. Kenaanite), or native of gentile Palestine

g5480.definition: [χάραγμα] from the same as {{g5482}}; a scratch or etching, i.e. stamp (as a badge of servitude), or sculptured figure (statue)

g5481.definition: [χαρακτήρ] from the same as {{g5482}}; a graver (the tool or the person), i.e. (by implication) engraving (("character"), the figure stamped, i.e. an exact copy or (figuratively) representation)

g5482.definition: [χάραξ] from χαράσσω (to sharpen to a point; akin to {{g1125}} through the idea of scratching); a stake, i.e. (by implication) a palisade or rampart (military mound for circumvallation in a siege)

g5483.definition: [χαρίζομαι] middle voice from {{g5485}}; to grant as a favor, i.e. gratuitously, in kindness, pardon or rescue

g5484.definition: [χάριν] accusative case of {{g5485}} as preposition; through favor of, i.e. on account of

g5485.definition: [χάρις] from {{g5463}}; graciousness (as gratifying), of manner or act (abstract or concrete; literal, figurative or spiritual; especially the divine influence upon the heart, and its reflection in the life; including gratitude)

g5486.definition: [χάρισμα] from {{g5483}}; a (divine) gratuity, i.e. deliverance (from danger or passion); (specially), a (spiritual) endowment, i.e. (subjectively) religious qualification, or (objectively) miraculous faculty

g5487.definition: [χαριτόω] from {{g5485}}; to grace, i.e. indue with special honor

g5488.definition: [Χαῤῥάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h2771}}); Charrhan (i.e. Charan), a place in Mesopotamia

g5489.definition: [χάρτης] from the same as {{g5482}}; a sheet ("chart") of writing-material (as to be scribbled over)

g5490.definition: [χάσμα] from a form of an obsolete primary χάω (to "gape" or "yawn"); a "chasm" or vacancy (impassable interval)

g5491.definition: [χεῖλος] from a form of the same as {{g5490}}; a lip (as a pouring place); figuratively, a margin (of water)

g5492.definition: [χειμάζω] from the same as {{g5494}}; to storm, i.e. (passively) to labor under a gale

g5493.definition: [χείμαῤῥος] from the base of {{g5494}} and {{g4482}}; a storm-runlet, i.e. winter-torrent

g5494.definition: [χειμών] from a derivative of χέω (to pour; akin to the base of 5490 through the idea of a channel), meaning a storm (as pouring rain); by implication, the rainy season, i.e. winter

g5495.definition: [χείρ] perhaps from the base of {{g5494}} in the sense of its congener the base of {{g5490}} (through the idea of hollowness for grasping); the hand (literally or figuratively (power); especially (by Hebraism) a means or instrument)

g5496.definition: [χειραγωγέω] from {{g5497}}; to be a hand-leader, i.e. to guide (a blind person)

g5497.definition: [χειραγωγός] from {{g5495}} and a reduplicated form of {{g71}}; a hand-leader, i.e. personal conductor (of a blind person)

g5498.definition: [χειρόγραφον] neuter of a compound of {{g5495}} and {{g1125}}; something hand-written ("chirograph"), i.e. a manuscript (specially, a legal document or bond (figuratively))

g5499.definition: [χειροποίητος] from {{g5495}} and a derivative of {{g4160}}; manufactured, i.e. of human construction

g5500.definition: [χειροτονέω] from a comparative of {{g5495}} and τείνω (to stretch); to be a hand-reacher or voter (by raising the hand), i.e. (generally) to select or appoint
